intro: Hygrophila saxatilis, commonly known as the rock hygrophila, is a species of flowering plant in the Acanthaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including India and Malaysia, and thrives in moist, rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, adding ornamental value to its natural environment. Hygrophila saxatilis is often found in stream banks and wetlands, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
